teaching_learning_inquiry: Action: Teaching and Learning through Inquiry
subunit_name_info: Optional descriptive name for this subunit (e.g., 'Exploration of linear functions').
lessons_per_subunit_info: Specify how many lessons this subunit will take to complete
prior_knowledge_subject_specific_info: Describe the subject-specific knowledge and skills that students should have before starting this unit. This includes prior concepts, mathematical procedures, scientific understanding, or other disciplinary knowledge.
prior_knowledge_learning_skills_info: Describe the general learning skills and study habits that students should have to be successful in this unit. This includes research skills, note-taking, time management, or other academic skills.
unit_content_placeholder: What will be taught in this subunit?
unit_content_info: Describe the disciplinary knowledge and skills students will develop in this lesson or phase of the module. Connect content to the module's concepts and inquiry. This ensures alignment with the overall learning goals rather than just listing activities.
success_criteria_info: Define how students will demonstrate progress and achievement. Phrase them in student-friendly 'I can…' statements linked to MYP objectives and command terms. Clear success criteria make expectations visible and guide self-assessment.
activities_info: Outline what students will actually do during the lesson — e.g., problem-solving, discussions, experiments, group tasks. Activities should give opportunities to practise the targeted skills and build toward the summative assessment. Think of them as the 'doing' part of learning.
learning_experiences_placeholder: How will the lesson be delivered?
learning_experiences_info: Explain how learning will happen: what approaches you as the teacher will use to guide, scaffold, and challenge students. This may include inquiry-based learning, modelling, guided practice, or collaborative structures. The focus is not only on what students do, but how you design the experience.
differentiation_placeholder: How will you support different learners?
differentiation_info: Detail how you will support diverse learners so all can access the content and achieve success. This might include scaffolds (sentence starters, visual aids), extension tasks for advanced learners, language support, or choice in content, process, or product. Differentiation is essential in MYP to ensure equity and inclusion.
interim_assessment_placeholder: What interim assessment will be used?
interim_assessment_info: Explain the checkpoint assessment(s) that take place mid-way through the module. These help you and students monitor progress toward the summative task. They should use the same criteria/strands as the summative but in a smaller, scaffolded form.
formative_assessment_placeholder: What formative assessment will be used?
formative_assessment_info: List the ongoing methods you will use to check student understanding during lessons, such as questioning, exit tickets, drafts, or peer/self-assessment. Formative assessments provide feedback for both teacher and students, guiding adjustments before summative tasks. In MYP, they are crucial for scaffolding success.
